questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of consent?
choices: Freely given
Reversible
Permanent
Enthusiastic
questions.answer: Permanent

questions.question: What is the purpose of using 'I' statements in communication?
choices: To blame the other person
To express feelings without blaming
To avoid responsibility
To win arguments
questions.answer: To express feelings without blaming

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a healthy relationship behavior?
choices: Checking your partner's phone messages without permission
Making all decisions without input from your partner
Supporting each other's goals and interests
Isolating your partner from friends and family
questions.answer: Supporting each other's goals and interests

questions.question: What is the definition of consent in the context of relationships?
choices: Agreeing to everything your partner wants
Voluntary, enthusiastic agreement to engage in sexual activity
Saying yes even if you're unsure
A one-time agreement that can't be changed
questions.answer: Voluntary, enthusiastic agreement to engage in sexual activity

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of setting a boundary in a relationship?
choices: Allowing your partner to make all decisions for you
Ignoring your own needs to please your partner
Telling your partner you need some alone time each week
Sharing all your passwords with your partner
questions.answer: Telling your partner you need some alone time each week

questions.question: What is active listening?
choices: Interrupting to share your own thoughts
Fully focusing on and understanding your partner
Listening only to the parts you agree with
Multitasking while your partner speaks
questions.answer: Fully focusing on and understanding your partner

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a quality of a healthy relationship?
choices: Mutual respect
Open communication
Controlling behavior
Equality
questions.answer: Controlling behavior

questions.question: What is the importance of maintaining independence in a relationship?
choices: It allows you to avoid commitment
It helps maintain individual identities and interests
It ensures you don't have to compromise
It prevents emotional intimacy
questions.answer: It helps maintain individual identities and interests

questions.question: Which of the following is a healthy way to resolve conflicts in a relationship?
choices: Avoiding the issue altogether
Using physical force to make your point
Focusing on the problem, not the person
Bringing up past mistakes to win the argument
questions.answer: Focusing on the problem, not the person

questions.question: What does equality in a relationship mean?
choices: One person makes all the decisions
Everything is split exactly 50/50 at all times
Balanced power dynamics and shared decision-making
The person who earns more money has more say
questions.answer: Balanced power dynamics and shared decision-making

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of non-verbal communication in relationships?
choices: Sending a text message
Writing a love letter
Body language and facial expressions
Having a phone conversation
questions.answer: Body language and facial expressions

questions.question: What is the purpose of creating a 'Relationship Bill of Rights'?
choices: To legally bind your partner to you
To outline fundamental rights everyone should have in a healthy relationship
To list all the things your partner must do for you
To replace the need for communication in the relationship
questions.answer: To outline fundamental rights everyone should have in a healthy relationship

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a type of boundary in relationships?
choices: Physical
Emotional
Financial
Telepathic
questions.answer: Telepathic

questions.question: What is the role of trust in a healthy relationship?
choices: It allows you to control your partner
It creates a foundation of security and intimacy
It eliminates the need for communication
It ensures you never disagree
questions.answer: It creates a foundation of security and intimacy

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of respecting privacy in a relationship?
choices: Reading your partner's diary without permission
Demanding to know your partner's whereabouts at all times
Allowing your partner to have private conversations with friends
Insisting on sharing all passwords
questions.answer: Allowing your partner to have private conversations with friends

questions.question: What is the importance of empathy in relationships?
choices: It allows you to manipulate your partner's feelings
It helps you understand and relate to your partner's perspective
It eliminates all disagreements
It replaces the need for verbal communication
questions.answer: It helps you understand and relate to your partner's perspective

questions.question: Which of the following is a sign of an unhealthy relationship?
choices: Open communication about feelings
Respecting each other's boundaries
Excessive jealousy or possessiveness
Supporting each other's personal growth
questions.answer: Excessive jealousy or possessiveness

questions.question: What is the purpose of using 'we' language in conflict resolution?
choices: To blame both partners equally
To avoid taking personal responsibility
To emphasize partnership and shared problem-solving
To make the other person feel guilty
questions.answer: To emphasize partnership and shared problem-solving

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of assertive communication?
choices: Expressing needs clearly
Respecting others' rights
Being aggressive to get your way
Standing up for yourself
questions.answer: Being aggressive to get your way

questions.question: What is the importance of maintaining individual friendships in a romantic relationship?
choices: It allows you to compare your partner to others
It helps maintain a sense of independence and personal identity
It provides an escape from your relationship
It makes your partner jealous, which is healthy
questions.answer: It helps maintain a sense of independence and personal identity

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a healthy way to express affection?
choices: Demanding constant attention
Showing affection only when you want something
Respecting your partner's comfort level with physical touch
Insisting on public displays of affection even if your partner is uncomfortable
questions.answer: Respecting your partner's comfort level with physical touch

questions.question: What is the role of compromise in a healthy relationship?
choices: One person always gives in to keep the peace
It's unnecessary if you truly love each other
It helps find mutually satisfactory solutions to conflicts
It means taking turns getting your way
questions.answer: It helps find mutually satisfactory solutions to conflicts

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of effective communication in relationships?
choices: Active listening
Using 'I' statements
Interrupting to make your point
Expressing feelings clearly
questions.answer: Interrupting to make your point

questions.question: What is the importance of setting personal goals in a relationship?
choices: It allows you to compete with your partner
It helps maintain individual identity and personal growth
It shows that the relationship isn't important
It replaces the need for shared goals
questions.answer: It helps maintain individual identity and personal growth

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of respecting boundaries in a digital context?
choices: Sharing your partner's personal information on social media
Demanding access to all of your partner's online accounts
Asking permission before posting photos of your partner online
Constantly messaging your partner throughout the day
questions.answer: Asking permission before posting photos of your partner online

questions.question: What is the purpose of the anonymous question box in the lesson plan?
choices: To gossip about classmates
To allow students to ask sensitive questions without embarrassment
To test the teacher's knowledge
To collect personal information about students
questions.answer: To allow students to ask sensitive questions without embarrassment

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a key vocabulary term in the lesson plan?
choices: Consent
Boundaries
Manipulation
Respect
questions.answer: Manipulation

questions.question: What is the purpose of the role-playing exercise in the lesson plan?
choices: To entertain the class
To practice acting skills
To demonstrate healthy and unhealthy relationship behaviors
To embarrass students
questions.answer: To demonstrate healthy and unhealthy relationship behaviors

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as a topic in the 'Healthy Relationships' learning unit?
choices: Qualities of healthy relationships
Consent and boundaries
Effective communication in relationships
Sexual techniques
questions.answer: Sexual techniques

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'Relationship Reflection Journal' writing exercise?
choices: To practice creative writing skills
To share personal information with the class
To reflect on personal experiences and beliefs about relationships
To critique other people's relationships
questions.answer: To reflect on personal experiences and beliefs about relationships
